text.sentence: C.H. Robinson produced another record quarter with improved margins, providing further evidence of incremental challenges in freight markets.

Nonetheless, we expect earnings outperformance will continue for the asset light broker and valuation is relatively `cheap', reinforcing one of our very few large cap Overweight ratings in the sector.
Guidance for net revenue growth of seven percent in January is encouraging, but we suspect investors will focus on pricing, which was down three percent in the quarter.
Nonetheless, `buy rates' for purchased transportation continue to decline faster, evident by continued weakness in spot markets.
With the company's shares trading at a historically low multiple, we think CHRW is increasingly attractive within a difficult universe.
CHRW reported fourQfifteen EPS of eighty eightc, above our eighty fivec and consensus eighty sevenc estimates.
Relative to our model, solid volume growth and better `gross' margins drove a net revenue beat of dollar thirty threemm, or six percent .
Personnel expenses also came in higher, resulting in an EBIT beat of dollar tenmm, or fourc.
Below the line, higher interest and other expense and a lower tax rate explain the remainder of the variance.
CHRW's Transportation net revenue margin reached nineteen percent this quarter, matching a fourQ record last seen in two thousand eight.

As we have highlighted over the past year, expanding brokerage margins are a classic late cycle signal, as asset based owners offer discounted `buy' rates in order to fill increasingly available capacity.
CHRW's margins have been expanding since two thousand thirteen, and it is the fourth company this earnings season to post yet another quarter of improvement .

We realize a decade of technological advancements and increased competition likely justifies a lower multiple for a more mature C.H, Robinson, but we highlight the shares' all time low P/E, which is ~two.five
After accounting for fourQ results, we take our two thousand sixteen and two thousand seventeen EPS estimates to dollar three.seventy and dollar three.ninety

Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision.
PLEASE SEE ANALYST CERTIFICATION AND IMPORTANT DISCLOSURES BEGINNING ON PAGE five.

North America Transportation Industry View: NEUTRAL Stock Rating: OVERWEIGHT two thousand seventeenE fourteen thousand five hundred sixty nine hundred eighty six nine hundred fifteen eight hundred eighty six five hundred forty nine three.ninety
six two thousand eighteenE fifteen thousand three hundred forty nine one thousand three nine hundred thirty eight hundred ninety eight five hundred fifty six four.ten
C.H. Robinson is the largest truckload brokerage in the U.S., affording significant market share advantage relative to much smaller competitors.
However, aggressive expansion of lower cost and lower return brokers suggests a slower growth outlook for a relatively expensive stock.
CHRW upside case is estimated assuming an improving freight rate environment drives gross revenue margin spreads wider by one percent, relative to our current estimates.
CHRW downside case is estimated assuming a weaker freight rate environment drives gross revenue margin spreads to compress by one percent, relative to our current estimates.

Income statement Revenue EBITDA EBIT Pre tax income Net income EPS Diluted shares DPS Margin and return data EBITDA margin EBIT margin Pre tax margin Net margin ROIC ROA ROE Balance sheet and cash flow Tangible fixed assets Intangible fixed assets Cash and equivalents Total assets Short and long term debt Other long term liabilities Total liabilities Net debt/ Shareholders' equity Change in working capital Cash flow from operations Capital expenditure Free cash flow Valuation and leverage metrics P/E EV/EBITDA Equity FCF yield EV/sales P/BV Dividend yield Total debt/capital
We value C.H. Robinson Worldwide Inc. shares at dollar seventy five, which is based on an average of eleven.fivex
EV/EBITDA and nineteenx P/E multiples on our two thousand seventeen EBITDA forecast of dollar nine hundred eighty sixmm and our two thousand seventeen EPS forecast of dollar three.ninety

Guide to the Barclays Fundamental Equity Research Rating System: Our coverage analysts use a relative rating system in which they rate stocks as Overweight, Equal Weight or Underweight relative to other companies covered by the analyst or a team of analysts that are deemed to be in the same industry .
In addition to the stock rating, we provide industry views which rate the outlook for the industry coverage universe as Positive, Neutral or Negative .
A rating system using terms such as buy, hold and sell is not the equivalent of our rating system.
Investors should carefully read the entire research report including the definitions of all ratings and not infer its contents from ratings alone.
Stock Rating Overweight The stock is expected to outperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.
Equal Weight The stock is expected to perform in line with the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelvemonth investment horizon.
Underweight The stock is expected to underperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.

Rating Suspended The rating and target price have been suspended temporarily due to market events that made coverage impracticable or to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies in certain circumstances including where the Investment Bank of Barclays Bank PLC is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving the company.
Neutral industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are steady, neither improving nor deteriorating.
Below is the list of companies that constitute the industry coverage universe: North America Transportation C.H. Robinson Worldwide Inc.

Heartland Express, Inc. Kansas City Southern Swift Transportation Co. Werner Enterprises Inc. Distribution of Ratings: Barclays Equity Research has one thousand eight hundred eighty six companies under coverage.

Guide to the Barclays Research Price Target: Each analyst has a single price target on the stocks that they cover.
The price target represents that analyst's expectation of where the stock will trade in the next twelve months.

Top Picks: Barclays Equity Research's Top Picks represent the single best alpha generating investment idea within each industry, taken from among the Overweight rated stocks within that industry.
Barclays Equity Research publishes global and regional Top Picks reports every quarter and analysts may also publish intra quarter changes to their Top Picks, as necessary.
While analysts may highlight other Overweight rated stocks in their published research in addition to their Top Pick, there can only be one Top Pick for each industry.

Risks which May Impede the Achievement of the Barclays Research Valuation and Price Target: Investing in transportation companies can be risky.

In addition to macroeconomic risks, the companies' earnings can be exposed to risk from changing geopolitical conditions, changing fuel prices, labor disputes, weather disruptions and operational challenges, among other things.
